results.title: It's up to us, it's up to you

results.brief_description: This is an inspiring story about sharing culture amongst indigenous communities and with the wider community to promote understanding and tolerance.

results.title: Bidja
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Bidja Atkinson
results.brief_description: Of Yorta Yorta descent, Bidja Atkinson talks about his love for the bush and his life living just outside of Echuca with his family of artists and musicians.
results.description: Of Yorta Yorta descent, Bidja Atkinson talks about his love for the bush and his life living just outside of Echuca with his family of artists and musicians.

results.title: World #37...previsited
results.brief_description: World #37…previsited is a 3D computer animation (created on 3D Studio 4) of a futuristic city run by warring armed robotic soldiers. The film initially navigates the viewer through the city absent of people to focus on the only visible inhabitants being the robotic soldiers who begin to march to war. The 3D Cafe (Platinum Pictures) made the original models for the mountains, trees, the colossal statue, dragon gargoyles and robot’s skirts and boots.

results.title: The Great Australian cultural exchange programme
results.brief_description: A humourous hand-drawn 2D computer animation of newly arrived Chinese immigrants being chased through the landscape by a ‘banana in pyjamas’, B0, as opposed to B1 and B2 of the ABC childrens program Bananas in Pyjamas.
results.description: A humourous hand-drawn 2D computer animation of newly arrived Chinese immigrants being chased through the landscape by a ‘banana in pyjamas’, B0, as opposed to B1 and B2 of the ABC childrens program Bananas in Pyjamas.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: Essence of Terror
results.brief_description: An inquisitive young boy explores the contents of the medicine cabinet and is tempted into trying the jar labelled ‘Adol Essence’… He is plunged into a world of terror as his body starts to change in alarming new ways.
results.description: An inquisitive young boy explores the contents of the medicine cabinet and is tempted into trying the jar labelled ‘Adol Essence’… He is plunged into a world of terror as his body starts to change in alarming new ways.

results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Linda Wordie
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.
results.description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.

results.title: Days of Echuca
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Barbara Day
results.brief_description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.
results.description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. results.title: Octikuki
results.brief_description: Octikuki uses 2D and 3D computer animation to create a futuristic creation scene. The animation plays with themes nature and science reading as a visual poem. The music soundtrack ‘Sweet Thunder’ is by Yello.
